oracle.mapviewer.share.stylex
Class Bucket

java.lang.Object
  oracle.mapviewer.share.stylex.Bucket
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CollectionBucket, RangedBucket
public abstract class Bucket
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

A Bucket defines a range or collection of feature values. It is also typically associated with a (primitive) rendering and labeling style. A set of Buckets make up a BucketSeries, which is used in many types of the Advanced Styles such as ColorSchemeStyle for thematic mapping.

See Also:
BucketSeries, Serialized Form

contains

public abstract boolean contains(Field v)
Checks if this Bucket contains the given Field object. A Bucket contains a Field if the value of the Field either falls within the range of the Bucket (RangedBucket), or matches one of the member values of the Bucket (CollectionBucket).

Returns:
boolean - true if the value of the given Field is contained by the Bucket; false otherwise.

setBucketLabel

public void setBucketLabel(java.lang.String l)
Sets the label for this bucket. This label is only used as the display name of this bucket in a map legend.

Parameters:
l - - bucket label

setBucketId

public void setBucketId(java.lang.String bucketId)
Sets a unique Id for this Bucket. It must be unique among the BucketSeries that contains this Bucket.

Parameters:
bucketId - - the id to be set for this Bucket

getBucketId

public java.lang.String getBucketId()
Returns the unique Id of this Bucket. The Id only needs to be unique among the BucketSeries that contains this Bucket.

Returns:
String the unique Id of this Bucket
